On an official visit to China, passing through Macau, Luís Montenegro highlighted China's fundamental role in the global context
The Portuguese Prime Minister stated yesterday, before the President of the People's Republic of China, Xi Jinping, that he counts on his close relationship with Russia to “build a fair and lasting peace” in Ukraine. Luís Montenegro made these statements at the beginning of the first day of his official visit to China, during the meeting with Xi Jinping, of which journalists were only able to record the first three minutes. “I cannot fail, on behalf of the Government of Portugal, to convey to Mr. President that we greatly count on your contribution and the close relationship that China maintains with the Russian Federation so that we can, as quickly as possible, build a fair and lasting peace in Ukraine”, he stated. Previously, Montenegro highlighted that, in the international context, Portugal and China have maintained “on many occasions a basis of cooperation and shared values”. “China has a fundamental role in the global and international context, it is a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council and we hope for your contribution so that we can build bridges between peoples, bring together some of those who are in conflict, promote peace, promote multilateralism, promote respect for human rights”, stated the Portuguese politician. Montenegro said he was confident that the appeal he addressed to the president of China about the Russian-Utrinia conflict will be heard. "I believe that the appeal, coming from a friendly country, coming from a European Union (EU) country, coming from a country, such as Mr. President XI Jinping also emphasized, who has an identity of values ​​and route, will not fall into a rotor bag," he said. Saying not being able to answer for the president of China, Montenegro has manifested convinced that Portugal has done what is required for this conflict. "My conviction is that, to our dimension and without any kind of pretentiousness, we do what is required to a nation with history and the international respectability that Portugal has. We are builders of bridges, we are protagonists of the approach between peoples, we are advocates of peace, defenders of values, respect for people's rights," he said. Montenegro considered that, at the meeting with Xi Jinping, he was limited to “being frank, loyal and direct in the appeal” so that China's ability to influence and “bring practical results” to Ukraine. Luís Montenegro also mentioned that “it is very tasteful” that he makes this official visit to China, after brief statements by Chinese President Xi Jinping. "As Mr. President said, Portugal and China have a relationship founded on a story that has shared with various times in common, but also a relationship facing the future. I remember Mr. President's visit to Portugal for seven years and I also want to convey the greetings of Mr. President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa," he said. Good friends The Portuguese Prime Minister expressed agreement with the words of Xi Jinping about how the transition from the administration of Macao de Portugal to China in 1999 took place. "We had in the transition from Macau a good expression of the way we were able to converge and we managed to ensure the cultural identity and the relationship between the special administrative region of Macau, with Portugal and with China," he said. At yesterday's meeting, Xi Jinping said that “Portugal is a good friend of China”, saying that it is “a pleasure” to meet the Prime Minister, Luís Montenegro. “Welcome on the visit to China. I remember that in 2018 I made a state visit to Portugal, which left me a beautiful impression, and deep,” he said, taking the opportunity to ask Montenegro to transmit to the Portuguese head of state, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, “sincere greetings”, according to the simultaneous translation into Portuguese of his statements. The Chinese president stressed that China and Portugal "are countries with deep history, and the two peoples have idiosyncrasy, openness, inclusion, progress and autonomy", arguing that "Portugal plays an important and unique role on the international stage." Xi Jinping also highlighted “the important role” played by three former Portuguese prime ministers in international and regional affairs. "The Secretary General of the United Nations, António Guterres, the president of the European Council, António Costa, and the former president of the European Commission Durão Barroso. I have good relations with them," he said. In the brief statement, the Chinese president stated that "Portugal is a good friend of China" and considered that both countries have "properly resolved" the issue of Macao through friendly negotiations. " “Portugal was also the first country in Western Europe to sign acts of cooperation with China under the ‘One Belt, One Route’ initiative, and the first country in the Euro Zone to issue bonds” in Chinese currency, he said. A little help in the crisis In turn, Luís Montenegro thanked China's support to Portugal during the period of the financial crisis. "At the level of our bilateral economic cooperation, it is my duty to tell you that we do not forget, on the contrary, we have very well present and respect the bet that China has developed in the Portuguese economy, in one of the most critical moments of our country, when the financial crisis," he said. As had been highlighted moments before by the President of the People's Republic of China, Montenegro also considered that, in recent years, the two countries have strengthened ties “in various sectors of the economy, from energy to banking, from health to water supply”. “Our conviction is that we can continue to follow this path based on trust,” said the prime minister. Luís Montenegro landed in Beijing early Monday afternoon, closed to the media, and did not have any public agenda that day. The prime minister's official agenda began yesterday morning with a ceremony of deposition of a wreath at the monument to the people of the people, in Tiananmen Square, where he was accompanied by his wife and three ministers who are part of this visit: Paulo Rangel, Minister of State and Foreign Affairs, Manuel Castro Almeida, Minister of Economics and Territorial Cohesion, and Graça Carvalho, Minister of Environment and Energy. In addition to the meeting with XI Jinping, Luís Montenegro met first with the president of the China National Popular Assembly, Zhao Leji. At the end of the afternoon, the head of the Portuguese Government had a working meeting with his Chinese counterpart, Li Qiang, also at the Grand Palace of the People, and then continued on to Macau, where he only has an agenda today in the morning. Tomorrow and Friday, Montenegro will make an official visit to Japan, with visits to Tokyo and Osaka. Pilfe At HM, analyst Tiago André Lopes, an auxiliary professor responsible for Asia Study at Lusíada do Porto University, argued that “Lisbon and Beijing share quite different views regarding international conflicts”. It should be noted that Montenegro visits China when they spend a few days about the summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, which took place in the Chinese town of Tianjin, and where conflicts were discussed Gaza or Russia-Ucrania. "We can see that Lisbon is distinctive in the Palestinian issue, looking little uncomfortable with the barbarism that is slaughtered over the Palestinians; while China positions itself in a different spectrum of Portugal in the Ukraine War. What does this tell us? The trip will be very focused on the dimension of economic diplomacy and much less in the so -called traditional diplomacy," said the analyst. Tiago André Lopes considers that Portugal could take advantage of this trip through Asia "to self-admit some of the dependence on the Brussels-Washington axis and gain space for maneuver by integrating Beijing's Force," although "the current government bets on an atlanticism-Europeist without global ambitions." Asked about the issue of 5G, which has shaped the Portugal-China relationship in recent months, Tiago André Lopes understands that Montenegro's trip to Beijing serves to “minimize the impact” of this issue and “try to boost economic cooperation between the two countries”. "An element that could help measure the pulse of the visit of the Prime Minister of Portugal will be the signing of documents. Will Memoranda of Understanding (which are generally not binding), or Commercial Agreements be signed? Or just vague press releases? This will be the best barometer, in addition to the circumstantial words that will naturally be uttered", he highlighted. Investments | Montenegro says Portugal is “reliable and confident” Luís Montenegro said yesterday that during the official visit to China and then Japan, he wants to bring the message that Portugal “is a reliable and confident country” for economic investments. According to the prime minister, the program “brings together the opportunity for the Portuguese prime minister to talk and interact directly with the president of the National Assembly of the People's Republic of China, with the President of the Republic, with the prime minister”. "At the same time that the Minister of State and Foreign Affairs, the Minister of Economy and the Minister of Environment and Energy interact bilaterally with their counterparts and also with entrepreneurs and Chinese companies that operate in Portugal and with Portuguese companies operating in China," he added. For Montenegro, the fact that the visits are being made “with some compression in terms of durability” - four days divided between China and Japan - should be seen from another perspective. “It's just the record that we are capable of doing all this simultaneously, we are capable of leaving from here to Macau, we are capable of leaving Macau for Tokyo and for us to be able, in this geographical area, to bring the message that Portugal is a confident country, it is a trustworthy country, it is a country worth looking at and that also looks at the world”, he defended. Montenegro also pointed out that Portugal is already “enjoying several investments that originate in China and have been levers for the transformation and economic development of Portugal”. “It is our intention to contribute by coming here so that we can also open doors so that more Portuguese companies can find the destination of their products in the Chinese market and, through this, also increase our export share to this geography”, he stated. A.S.S. / Lusa

item.title: Elections | Campaign advances to the last few days in “mpop” style
item.description:
The elections for the Legislative Assembly are scheduled for the 14th, so the election campaign is almost over. In a report by Lusa agency, there are details of the “MPOP” style of the election campaign, with a lot of music and requests for financial support to the mixture
Crowded audience, all dressed in the gowns on the list with which they compete for the elections on the 14th; Chinese drums next to the stage and above candidates and supporters, various microphones, music and choreography. This is the campaign for Macao legislatures, in a style that can be called "MPOP". The microphones change hands, reproducing the same slogans with different voices, in short phrases and high scales, which almost all end in a party instruction. At this point, the drums are heard loudly and the audience reproduces the last note heard, while at the same time loudly shaking the political merchandise given to them at the beginning of the rally: plastic hands to clap, list numbers with LED lights, malleable straws, fans, all with the same strong color. Campaign actions in Macao, restricted to the last two weeks before legislative elections for the local parliament, do not contain speeches in the events of the six lists that will elect 14 of the 33 deputies to the Legislative Assembly (AL). The remaining 12 candidates are chosen through associations, via indirect suffrage, and there are still seven deputies appointed by the Chief Executive, in this case Sam Hou Fai. Describing campaign events is like an exercise in similarity to musical shows, namely the “kpop” genre, among the lists led by younger candidates, or the “old-style pop” genre, as if it were figures like Elvis or Olivia Newton John resurrected. The concentrations are made up of members of the lists and the people mobilized by them, both dressed in the same uniforms. But there are no politicians on the stages and no spectators listening to them. In these events, politicians seem to be assumed as artists, but there are no audiences, because they seem to be part of the choreography. Finally, there are very few people besides and each other, that is, people watching who are not directly linked to the lists. Abstention is the great ghost that hangs over the whole process, which takes place for the first time under the framework of the new Electoral Law of April 2024, which aims to "reinforce the implementation of the" Macao Macao governed by Patriotas "principle. Os desafios económicos Ilia Chou, 40, an employee of the financial sector, was with a child and a friend watching one of these rallies and seemed to be one of those few people present not involved in the campaign list. He agreed to talk to Lusa after he had spoken to another microphone. Ilia was attracted to the list there because those people have a “young and community aspect” and are concerned with “offering prospects for progress” to young people. "Given the current challenging economic climate, we face a critical issue: our young people now have fewer options than before. This specific aspect is what attracts me most to this initiative," he said. But "other groups also talk about youth and employment, what are the differences? Why do you like this group in particular?", we asked. "I don't know them [the other groups]. Well, I was attracted by the charming characters on this list", he replied. “I think these four characters are quite charming”, added Ilia, they talk about “love, the title is very charming, and the color is pink, it looks very welcoming”. Political programs are, without exception, lists of requests to an “provider father”, incarnated by the executive, who has the responsibility of managing a comfortable and growing financial reserve, fueled by taxes paid by the six game dealers in Macao. The numbers show this comfort. In August, Macau's Financial Reserve, which was constantly growing throughout the first half of the year, reached 647.3 billion patacas, and was invested in subcontracted investments, deposits, current accounts, and credit securities. The lists want it to also be applied to initiatives such as the creation of a development fund and the reversion of 10 percent of profits for distribution to all citizens, they want an increase in pensions or more money in consumption coupons, subsidies and maternity leaves, they want more social housing, they want free healthcare and higher education, or they simply demand a greater annual distribution of money. Pasta There are also other demands, such as the promotion of economic diversification, measures to support the transformation and modernization of Small and Medium-sized Companies or the development of smart cities, but the most significant part of the programs on the six lists points directly to the distribution of money by the Government, in the most varied forms. The other recipients of the requests are the game dealers, to which the candidates go with warnings that they are determined to defend the priority of residents in access to the best paid jobs. Macao's unemployment rate is 2 percent and permanent residents at 2.6 percent. That is, technically, Macau has full employment. However, as Lusa told a candidate, the employment issue has nothing to do with statistics, it just holds on with "perception." And in fact the issue of unemployment, especially for those who have just graduated, is a pressing issue for political programs, as HM indicated. This is the case of the first list to compete for direct suffrage, the “Association of United Citizens of Macau”, which is led by Song Pek Kei, a deputy linked to the Fujian community, who took his first steps in politics alongside businessman Chan Meng Kam. The list led by the deputy calls, for example, for the creation of a quota for residents in all professional areas, “support for employment and local businesses”, and the guarantee that “85 percent, or more, of employees are local residents”. The Nova Esperança list, led by José Pereira Coutinho, and one of the few Macanese participants in these elections, calls for “jobs for all”, a slogan present in its electoral program which promises “employment priority for permanent residents of Macau in gaming concessionaires”. Who goes out to their List campaigns for indirect suffrage may seem more discreet, but that doesn't mean there is no news. After investing in Global Media, Portugal, and betting on the real estate area, in Porto, Kevin Ho, the nephew of the first chief executive, Edmund Ho, bet on local politics, when entering the list “Union of Macao Business Interests”, led by José Chui Sa Peng. Also he is familiar, in this case, from a previous head of the Executive of MSAR, Chui Sai On, already removed from the political scene. In the case of these lists, representing the sectors of work, culture, education or business interests, employment is a concern, but what the candidates are looking for is a Government that knows how to support companies and, ultimately, diversify the economy. Thus, the “Union of Business Interests of Macau” advocates “support for digital and high-technology transformation to modernize traditional industries and develop emerging sectors”. The candidates promise to play the role of intermediaries between those who face difficulties in maintaining themselves in this business fabric and the Executive, by “listening carefully to the difficulties and demands of the commercial and financial industries, especially small and medium-sized companies”. The names of the seven nominated deputies are not yet known, as the choice of the Chief Executive is usually only made public after the elections. A.S.S. / Lusa

item.title: Suicide | Administration stops publishing data
item.description:
After, in 2024, the number of suicides has reached the highest value since there are records, health services have been since the second quarter of the year without presenting data on the phenomenon. TDM advances that there were at least 40 suicides between April and October, but the actual number should be higher than the
The Health Services (SS) stopped publishing data on the number of suicides, a statistic that used to be released quarterly. The data withholding comes after in 2024 the number of suicides was the highest ever in the territory. In addition to not having published the data for the second quarter, which, taking the previous year as a reference, should have been published in August, the SS also ignored several requests made by Canal Macau regarding the compilation of this statistics. The public broadcaster reveals that since April has filed several requests to the SS to realize the reasons for the delay in disclosure of the data, but for months that is ignored by the body led by Alvis Lo. The new tendency to deal with health statistics also happened a few months after Sam Hou Fai assumed the position of Chief Executive. This is a totally different stance from that adopted by its predecessors, when the numbers were considered public information. In the first quarter of the year, 18 cases of suicide were reported, which appeared to indicate a reduction of four incidents compared to the period between January and March 2024. That year, a total of 90 suicides were recorded, the highest number since 2003. However, since 2021 there has been a successive increase in the annual number of suicides, without the trend being reversed, despite the authorities regularly promising to pay attention to the situation. About 40 deaths Given the absence of statistics, the Macao channel turned to messages shared by the Judiciary Police to try to calculate the number of suicides. PJ messages present challenges in collecting information because they often classify cases simply as “discovery of a corpse” without suspected signs of crime, which does not always allow for the distinction between suicide or a death linked to the victim's health conditions. Despite these challenges, the Macao channel has accounted for the messages in which it was clear that the deaths were due to suicide cases and indicates that from April to October there have been at least 40 people to put an end to life. However, the actual number should be higher. The ages of the victims were not determined by the station, because the PJ failed to disclose the ages, using, instead of generic descriptions, such as middle age, a term that can cover people over 30 and up to 65 years. Still, TDM said most of the victims were "middle age". There were 10 cases with young people and one case with a minor. Among the suicide victims, there are also some cases of elderly. All those who are emotionally distressed or consider that they are in a situation of desperation must call to call the open line “Caritas Life Hope” by telephone 28525222 in order to obtain emotional counseling services.

item.title: Traders warn of consequences of the satellite casinos closure
item.description: Businesspeople told Lusa that the closure of satellite casinos threatens the survival of economic sectors that depend on them, such as pawnshops and luxury retail. The streets of the ZAPE and NAPE areas, once lively with players, are becoming deserted. "The pawnshops in these areas will simply close or move. I don't see any other solution," the president of the General Association of Pawnbrokers of Macau, Alexander Wai Kai Leung, told Lusa. It is expected that at least nine of the city's 11 satellite casinos cease operations by December 31, a period of a period of grace period of three years granted to agreements between the operators of the game spaces and the dealers under which they operated. Among the satellite casinos located in the areas of Zape and NAPE are the Casa Real, Fortune, Kam Pek, Landmark, Legend Palace and Waldo. Lusa tried to contact the hotels that houses these spaces, but none of its employees could indicate what the future of the place will be after closing. Grand Emperor serves as an example: the casino has closed three years ago and the facilities remain empty to this day. "If the casinos close, the impact on us is significant. Our livelihood depends on players," Leung said, also expressing the hope that the satellite casinos will remain open. Letter of intent The Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) told Lusa that it “intends to attract visitors” to the Zape area to support local commerce. Measurements for the doing include events, improvement of the urban landscape and the offer of special packages directed to concert spectators, which include 'vouchers' of purchases and museum tickets. Businesspeople like Leong remain skeptical, however. The president of the pawnshops association questions these measures, considering them useless for pawnshops. "Our industry depends on players as its main customers. They can attract people to dine on the street, but I don't see how that benefits us," he said, adding that he feels that the sector has been "marginalized by the authorities, who consider the business 'high risk' for money laundering." According to the association, there are around 25 pawnshops in the ZAPE and NAPE area. The threat extends beyond pawnshops. Store windows like the In Vo Chong Group display shark fins, ‘premium whiskey’ and Moutai, captivating a wealthy clientele. Owner, Lok Chi Lai, Deputy Secretary General of the Hong Kong and Macau Swallow Nests Association, recognizes government efforts to increase the influx of people other than gaming space regulars. However, he told Lusa, these initiatives “cannot attract high range customers to consume”, only attract “young people to take photographs”, clarifying that there are more than 40 establishments of this kind in both areas of the city. "Those who come to play are willing to buy luxury goods at higher prices to offer. Without these customers, the future doesn't look so laughing," Lok said. On the other hand, he added, promoting hotel offer located at Zape and Nape is also ineffective because "the hotels here are old (…), and high -end customers prefer to stay in five -star hotels in Cotai."

item.title: AMCM | Macao and Cape Verde regulators reinforce cooperation
item.description:
The new agreement was signed on Thursday and announced the following day. The signing took place during the 12th edition of the Meeting of Governors of the Central Banks of Portuguese-speaking Countries, in the City of Praia
The Monetary Authority of Macao (AMCM) has announced that it signed a new agreement to “deepen cooperation” in matters in financial supervision with the Cape Verde Central Bank. The financial regulator said the protocol with the Cape Verde bank covers the “fight against the laundering of capital and the financing of terrorism, technical cooperation, the formation of professional staff”. According to a statement, the agreement also covers “supervision and exchange relating to emerging financial services, with the aim of jointly safeguarding the security and stability of the respective financial systems”. The document was signed on Thursday, during the 12th edition of the Meeting of Governors of the Central Banks of Portuguese-Speaking Countries, held in the capital of Cape Verde, Praia. The meeting, which took place behind closed doors, included interventions by governors and representatives of the central banks of Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Guinea-Bissau, Equatorial Guinea, Mozambique, Portugal, São Tomé and Príncipe, and Timor-Leste as well as the Central Bank of West African States and the Bank of Central African States. “This initiative symbolizes a deepening of cooperation and exchange between the two institutions in the field of financial supervision,” added AMCM. “This new agreement particularly focuses on collaboration in matters of prudential supervision, establishing a specific framework for cooperation between AMCM and Banco de Cabo Verde,” added the regulator. Since 1999 AMCM signed the first cooperation and technical assistance agreement with the Cape Verde Bank in 1999. In September 2024, during the second conference of the central banks and the financial areas between China and the Portuguese -speaking countries, which took place in Macao, Macau's financial regulator announced that it would update the protocol with the homologous institution of Cape Verde. AMCM has already signed bilateral cooperation agreements with 12 financial supervisory authorities from eight Portuguese-speaking countries.

item.title: Game | Revenue rises 6% in September despite super typhoon
item.description:
Macau casino revenues rose 6 percent in September compared to the same period in 2024, despite the temporary closure due to super typhoon Ragasa. Still, last month was the second weakest this year
The game sector raised 18.3 billion Patacas last month, another 6 percent of September last year. The registration represented the second lowest monthly amount of 2025, revealed the Macao Game Inspection and Game Coordination Directorate. Still, revenues have increased in annual terms, despite the passage of Ragasa, which led the authorities of the Chinese semi -autonomous region to end the casinos for 33 hours. Operators will have lost 880 million patacas in revenues, almost 5 percent from September, estimated Jeffrey Kiang, analyst at CLSA consultant, quoted by the Ggraia news portal. The amount recorded in September represents 82.8 percent of the same month of 2019, when Macao casinos had revenues of 22.1 billion patacas. In relation to the previous month, the territory's casinos collected 17.5 percent less gross revenue. However, it is worth mentioning that in August this year, the Macau gaming industry recorded the best monthly performance in January 2020, with gross revenues of around 22.16 billion patacas. Widen In terms of accumulated gross revenue, the first nine months of 2025 recorded an increase of 7.1 percent over the same period last year, reaching 181.3 billion patacas. Macao closed 2024 with total revenues of 226.8 billion patacas, more 23.9 percent than the previous year. The Macao government predicted, in the initial budget for 2025, that the year would close with total revenues of 240 billion patacas, which would represent a 6 percent increase compared to last year. But on June 11, the Legislative Assembly approved a new budget, proposed by the executive, which reduces the forecast for public revenues by 4.56 billion. Secretary for Economics and Finance, Anton Tai Kin IP, admitted to the deputies that the cut is due to the fact that the game's gross gross revenues in the first trimester of 2025 "was" slightly below planned. item.title: Human trafficking | Government in “strong opposition” to North American report
item.description:
The Government of MSAR reacts again with repudiation of a report by the Trump State Department of Administration, this time about human trafficking. The document points out that since 2021 there have been no convictions of traffickers, while the Executive denounces prejudice and “severe interference and expressed in the internal affairs of the MSAR”
"This 'report' denigrates the Macao SAR and contains defamatory and arbitrary statements regarding the notable fruits obtained by the Macao SAR, which is why it has no credibility. The USA has produced, year after year, reports with false information regarding the issues of human trafficking, in an attempt to create confusion in international society, constituting a serious and express interference in the internal affairs of the SAR. For these reasons, the authorities security officers vehemently repudiate this “report” and strongly demonstrate their dissatisfaction”. This is how the Government of Sam Hou Fai reacted to yet another report prepared by the US State Department on human trafficking, published on Monday. The local Executive's strong opposition was made public on Tuesday at the end of the day, with the Government stating that the document “is full of political prejudices and subjective judgments, in addition to ignoring objective facts”. The fact, highlighted by the department led by Marco Rubio, that Macau rarely convicts suspects involved in human trafficking, or identifies victims, is justified by the “joint efforts” of the Government and Macau society. “Crimes related to human trafficking have always recorded a low percentage or an almost zero percentage, which shows that Macau is one of the safest cities in the world”, highlights the Government. The value of the word The organism that belongs to the Trump administration acknowledges that the Macao government "has taken a few steps to combat human trafficking, namely investigating potential affairs, training staff and organizing seminars in schools to increase awareness for the subject." However, “general efforts to apply the law against trafficking and protection to victims remained inappropriate”, is indicated. The report also highlights that Macao SAR authorities have in the past considered that the victim's initial consent or “voluntary association” with a trafficker constituted sufficient evidence to demonstrate that a trafficking crime had not occurred.” This stance, according to the State Department, causes authorities to treat trafficking cases like other crimes and weakens efforts to identify victims. Reports from observers who pointed out that the lack of comprehensive legislation against trafficking in China negatively affected the ability of Macau authorities to conduct joint operations are also highlighted, something that caused a “disproportionate impact” on the fight against human trafficking, since the “victims exploited in Macau were predominantly from Mainland China”.

item.title: Administration | Johnson Ian advocates new mindset
item.description: Former candidate for the Legislative Assembly, Johnson Ian, argues that the main problem of Public Administration will not be resolved with government reform. In an opinion published in the newspaper Son Pou, the candidate excluded from the elections considered it more important to adopt a new mentality, focused on the quality of services and self-discipline, in order to respond to the needs of the population. Regarding the recent changes in the Government, Ian stated that it was the first time that this type of remodeling had happened in 26 years of the Macao SAR, after the transfer of sovereignty. However, the former number two on the list headed by deputy Ron Lam pointed out that the changes will be in vain if the Government does not know how to respond to social expectations, hold those in power accountable for their actions, listen to public consultations and use the public treasury well. Ian also addressed the news about the merger of the Cultural and Sports institutes. The former journalist considered that reducing the administrative machinery has been a common objective for governments for years, but that it has not been achieved.

item.title: Portugal | Sam Hou Fai visit should take place by June next year
item.description:
The Chief Executive highlighted that the official visit to Portugal is “quite important” for the development of Macau, and that he hopes that the trip will take place at the beginning of 2026
The Chief Executive plans to make an official visit to Portugal in the first half of next year, after being postponed from September. The target date was set on Wednesday, on the sidelines of the ceremonies marking the 76th anniversary of the establishment of the People's Republic of China. "I have communicated with Prime Minister Montenegro, and when he came to Macau told him that my wish was that my first visit abroad would be to Portugal," said Sam Hou Fai, according to Macau channel. "Now we are preparing the new lines of government action, but, I hope the visit can be made in the beginning of next year. Only then will we plan the visits to other countries," he added. Governing lines of action should be presented at the Legislative Assembly from November, until December, and constitute the governance plan for next year. The Chief Executive also highlighted the importance of visiting the MSAR, as it consider that it is a way to promote development. "[The trip] is a very important action for our development and I am convinced that it can be held in the first half of next year," he said. Visit postponed Initially, Sam Hou Fai's official visit to Portugal, which included a visit to Spain, was scheduled for the period between 16 and 23 September. However, just a few days before the trip, the Executive announced the postponement, without an official justification or new date being given. “The visit has been postponed and there is still no date for when it will take place”, said a source from the Social Communication Office (GCS) at the time, cited by Agência Lusa. However, the platform newspaper revealed that the postponement of the trip will have been related to the Portuguese Prime Minister's agenda. Between September 9 and 12, Luís Montenegro visited China and Japan, and the itinerary program in the Japanese country will have led the Portuguese authorities to consider that it would be more opportune to receive the leader of the government of Macao on another occasion. However, when he went to Macau, between the 9th and 10th of September, Luís Montenegro was received by Sam Hou Fai, in a meeting that took place behind closed doors at the Government headquarters. If the visit had not been postponed, the two would have held two meetings in just over a week.

item.title: The sin of incuria
item.description: On September 23rd and 24th, Typhoon Ragatsa hit Guangdong Province in mainland China, as well as Hong Kong and Macau, two special administrative regions of China. This super typhoon caused some damage in these three zones. Fortunately, everyone was prepared and the damage was minimal. The most serious occurrences were injuries caused in some people. In Hong Kong, a family decided to go to the jetty to observe the winds and the waves. Unfortunately the mother and son fell into the sea. The father jumped right away to save them leaving the 9 -year -old daughter alone, alone and crying. Other people who were there tried to save them immediately but couldn't. Luckily, a fishing boat was passing and the sailor and the son went to the victims' aid. The mother and son were unconscious and the father though conscious was slightly injured. Subsequently, Hong Kong's secretary for security, Chris Tang, said that although the “chase of winds and waves” (追風逐浪) was not criminalized in Hong Kong, bringing children into the storm during the passage of a typhoon can constitute “child neglect” (疏忽照顧兒童) and said the Hong Kong government will further investigate this matter. This means that the “persecution of winds and waves” can be criminalized. A few weeks ago, we mentioned in this column the lawsuit filed in Shenzhen against people who climbed the mountain during a storm. Currently, Hong Kong only has legislation that punishes entry to beaches closed by the Hong Kong Government, with a maximum fine of 2,000 HKD and 14 days in prison. However, only “entering prohibited areas” is criminalized and not “chasing winds and waves” during a storm. Ultimately, in Hong Kong, “wind and wave chasing” is not a crime. To completely prevent the tragedies caused by the “chase of winds and waves” during the passage of typhoons, it is necessary to implement legislation that criminalizes it. As we mentioned in the previous column, the act of “pursuing winds and waves” is difficult to define and regular. If the fact that it is on the beach during a storm is considered a crime of “chase of winds and waves”, many people will be accused. The law must be clear and detailed and its scope must be limited. Otherwise, a law is created that will be broken by many people, which will certainly not be the intention of the legislator. In addition, the current inspection agency is made up of employees of the Hong Kong government's cultural and leisure services department (LCSD), not the police. If there is resistance to employee indications, the situation will be even more chaotic. Another consideration in criminal legislation is the question of proof. How can it be proved that this group of people was "chasing winds" on the coast during a storm? LCSD employees, although on duty, also put their lives at risk during the weather and have simultaneously enforce the law. The adverse environment in law enforcement requires special attention. In other words, in a high risk environment, how can we guarantee that the LCSD team is applying the law in security? Perhaps Hong Kong could consider the use of drones to patrol the coast during the storms. If any “chase of winds and waves” were detected, it could immediately be issued a sound message by appealing to the withdrawal of the place. As this crime was recorded in film, if the infrastructors refused to leave the Hong Kong government would naturally have evidence to sue them. The success of this legislation would depend on the future attitude of Hong Kong society, which is why it is difficult to predict at the moment. However, the Hong Kong Government should certainly consider the possibility of forcing offenders to pay the costs of rescue operations. During a storm, rescue teams risk their lives to save those “chasing winds and waves,” and the equipment used is very expensive. It is not unreasonable to ask these “adventurers” to bear the costs. Legislation to regulate “wind and wave chasing” involves prevention rather than prosecution. These laws are intended to deter these behaviors. Criminal proceedings are only initiated after repeated warnings. Even with the legislation in force, its application is fraught with difficulties. Lastly, we must pay tribute to those who remain on duty during typhoons or carry out rescue operations. Without them, safety would be much lower during typhoons. Regarding the case of the family that fell into the sea in Hong Kong, we must pay tribute to all the rescuers. Your courage and selflessness in saving three people during a storm was admirable. Macau currently has a “civil defense legal system” (民防法律制度) and has implemented a series of measures to be applied during storms, such as preventive deployment, the evacuation of residents from riverside areas and ensuring supplies for daily needs. Many people were evacuated, demonstrating the robustness of Macau's civil defense system. Furthermore, there were no recorded incidents of “wind and wave chasing” on the coast, proof of the excellent work of the Macau Government in protecting the lives and property of residents. Macau residents take their personal safety very seriously. Therefore, although “chasing winds and waves” is not criminalized in Macau, people are careful. Currently, with unusual weather conditions and frequent and particularly powerful typhoons, Macau society must prioritize awareness and education to ensure that people understand what must be done to protect their lives and property during a storm. Only when everyone pays attention to safety can the impact of typhoons be minimized. item.title: New law of foreigners increases racism
item.description: Racism is increasingly an unfortunate reality in Portugal. It is enough to give you an example: in a classroom full of boys and white girls there was a black student, Kikas. The teacher asked the students what they had enjoyed most so far in life. Everyone answered and when Kikas commented on what he had liked most, he stressed that it had been the return to the world he had given. The teacher shouted him, calling him "liar !!!". Kikas replied that he did not accept the offense and informed the teacher that he was an adopted son of a very rich white family and had been walking around the world with his parents. Not satisfied, the teacher stressed, "Shut up! Types like you always end up on the street!" And he told him to leave the room giving him disciplinary lack. This is one of the many most deplorable examples of racist attitudes in our society. Last week, the AD/arrival alliance approved in the Assembly of the Republic a new law of foreigners. Criticism has been more than many, fundamentally because this law could increase racism in Portugal. Those who immediately came to Terreiro was the organization SOS racism that opposed the new law of immigrants, considering it a setback in protecting the guarantees of fundamental rights and freedoms, by altering the conditions of residence and obtaining citizenship directed to immigrants, including CPLP citizens. According to Mariana Carneiro, director of SOS Racism, the approval of the law with the support of the radical right represents a violation of the Constitution of the Portuguese Republic and the European Conventions of Human Rights, as well as the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. The SOS Racism leader has even denounced that immigration has been treated as a crime, which unfortunately is not new, because Portugal has been walking this path for a long time. Mariana Carneiro said that the government, sworn in March 2024, had already adopted an increasingly aligned stance with the far right yielding to racist and xenophobic principles present in Portuguese society. For the director of SOS Racism, the new law is a blatant attack on people who choose to live and work in our country, while Gold visas receive privileged treatment, when simultaneously increasingly restrictive immigration policies applied to other immigrants are implemented. The clamorous lead by the constitutional court of the initial version of the law on foreign residence authorization and family regrouping was a precious opportunity given by the President of the Republic to the Government to correct the shot in matters that are a test to humanistic values, defense of family principles and a privileged relationship with Lusophone countries. The solution found by AD and arrives is a legal tracery to circumvent the arguments of the Constitutional Court by maintaining all the political inconveniences of the initial version. It maintains as a rule of two years to request the family regrouping, from the granting of residence authorization and not of its request with the proof of payment of taxes and contributions to Social Security, despite the exceptions of reduction for one year when there are minor children. item.title: Artificial intelligence at the service of suicide (II)
item.description: Last week, we talked about a California couple who sued the technology company OpenAI and its CEO, Sam Altman, for having their artificial intelligence-generating chatbot, ChatGPT, provide information and encourage their 16-year-old son Ryan to commit suicide. This case is not complex, but the legal, ethical and technological issues it raises are worthy of extensive reflection. Although Ryan's parents have filed a lawsuit against OpenAI and its executive director, Sam Altman, this is a civil case and not a criminal case. The reason is simple: it is a recent technology and currently lacks legal regulation. If encouraging suicide is a crime, then it must be condemned. However, there is currently no law that provides for the possibility of this incentive from Artificial Intelligence platforms, thus making criminal actions impossible. The situation is similar for civil proceedings. Because there is no law stipulating that AI-induced suicide is illegal, Ryan's parents were only able to file a “product liability” lawsuit based on the “defective product” claim. The success of the case will depend on whether California courts accept the legal argument. From an ethical standpoint, Altman stated that OpenAI was trying to find ways to notify appropriate government agencies if in the future a minor seriously discussed suicide-related issues with ChatGPT and the company was unable to contact the parents. However, this method should not proceed because it goes against the company's privacy protection policy. He further stated that ChatGPT should not support or contest anything, which means that it should not take a position. From a technological perspective, AI is incapable of understanding the complexities of human thinking. For example, if one person says to another; Next time we meet, we'll have tea; the AI ​​just interprets it as; In the future, at any given moment, two people will drink tea. However, if these words are just an act of courtesy, and in fact the person who wrote them has no intention of reviewing the other, there is a psychological complexity here that is beyond the reach of current AI technology. When AI can't understand the true meaning of a sentence, how can users interpret its responses? After considering the legal, ethical and technological issues, what steps can we actually take to resolve the issues raised by AI? ChatGPT, originating in the United States, must be governed by North American law. In response to the Ryan case, we hope that this country will consider quickly adopting laws that regulate the civil and criminal liability of those who use AI for illegal purposes. ChatGPT users are spread across the world. When implementing laws that regulate the sector, the US should allow users from other countries to appeal to American courts to seek compensation or to bring actions similar to that of Ryan's parents. Let's imagine a British user who is faced with a similar situation. If the UK does not have specific legislation, the minor's parents have no other option than to file the case in the USA. Only with adequate legal protection can users around the world continue to access ChatGPT with confidence. If a company that runs ChatGPT discovers that a minor is morbidly interested in suicide and cannot contact his parents, but does not call the police for reasons of privacy protection, does that mean that privacy is more valuable than life? Under what terms can a company choose between protecting privacy and saving a life? Should you violate privacy to save a life, or should you turn a blind eye to potential suicide and protect privacy? The ethical questions are anyway; No choice is easy. If the right to privacy and the right to life are incompatible, can ChatgPT ignore certain questions merely not to answer? Or you may simply give an answer, "this question may be illegal, so I refuse to answer. The user must consult a lawyer before deciding whether to proceed." The Ryan case is just the beginning of the problems with AI. The more implanted this technology is, the more questions will arise. More unexpected and bizarre things will be revealed in the future. In addition to developing technology and improving AI quality, manufacturers should also make efforts to constantly remember employees of their social responsibilities, the importance of business ethics and the need for products to meet security standards. AI companies can take the initiative to conduct “ethics audits” with external auditors during annual financial audits to assess whether employees are up to business ethical standards and whether the company's ethical awareness is sufficient. This procedure would give users a lot of tranquility. Promotion and education are essential for users to correctly understand AI. If they realize that AI is just a computerized method of disseminating information, devoid of any human emotions, they will naturally be less inclined to trust their answers and the number of complicated cases will decrease. Only by fully understanding the limitations of AI and continually focusing on improvement can we maximize its benefits. item.title: “Lusofonia Awards” | Fundação Oriente distinguished

item.title: ARTM | Association celebrates 25 years with solidarity initiative
item.description: “Hike With a Purpose” is the name given to the initiative of the Macau Drug Rehabilitation Association to celebrate 25 years of existence. There are runs and walks, depending on the physical capacity of each person, scheduled for this Sunday, in the Natural Park of Barragem de Hac-Sá The Association for the Rehabilitation of Drug Addicts of Macau (ARTM) celebrates 25 years and to mark the event, it is promoting, this Sunday, from 6:30 am to 12 pm, the “Hike With a Purpose” initiative, which takes place in the Hac Sá Dam Natural Park, and which aims to take residents to walk or run in support of a cause. “This initiative is intended to promote a community free of illicit substances, encourage healthy lifestyles and habits, and encourage outdoor activities and community involvement among participants of all ages”, highlights the association in a note. The first edition of the event took place in 2022. This is an initiative that takes place in collaboration with Trailman 100 with two participation options, namely the “14Km Challenge Race” and the “8Km Fun Run”, both “designed to foster community spirit and promote physical fitness”. In the case of the “14km Challenge Race”, in individual format, it is made at a distance of 14 kilometers as the name implies and the registration should be made from 6:15 am to 07h, starting the race scheduled for 07h. Participants will have a time limit of 3 hours and 30 minutes and must be 16 years or older to participate. The “8Km Fun Run”, with groups of three people, is held over an eight-kilometre route, with mandatory registration between 8am and 9am and a scheduled start at 9am. Participants will have a time limit of 2 hours and 30 minutes and must be 8 years or older. Here, the prizes will be awarded to the winning group, while in the case of the individual race, the prizes will be awarded to the three best male and female runners. Heat This ARTM event also has the support of UFC Gym to “provide a warm-up session before the group fun run”, in addition to the fact that at the event there will be two stalls selling items, food and drink for charitable purposes, in partnership with “Friends U Can Keep Macau” and “Go Tower”, with part of the profits going to ARTM. The event is expected to attract around 300 participants, bringing together families, friends and community members in an attempt to engage “in healthy activities”, also increasing “awareness about preventing substance abuse”. In 1993, ARTM was born under the name “Ser Oriente” and began by offering conversation sessions and psychological support to drug addicts, in addition to focusing on their social integration. The association was renamed ARTM in 2000, and today it has reception centers for those addicted to alcohol, drugs or gambling, having created a therapeutic community that aims to heal without prison and return to life in society. ARTM also carries out social work in Ka-Hó, in the houses of the former leper colony, with the “Hold On To Hope” cafeteria and art gallery project.

item.title: Cinema | “The Memory of the Smell of Things” distinguished in Morocco
item.description: The film “The Memory of the Smell of Things”, by director António Ferreira, was distinguished with the honorable mention for 'best argument' at the Tanger Film Festival, in the northwest of Morocco, the producer announced yesterday. Persona Non Grata Pictures highlighted that the feature film was recognized by the festival's official jury “for the originality and subtlety with which the script addresses issues of aging”. The script was written by the director himself and co-screenwriter Tiago Cravidão, the producer said in a statement. “This is a film about empathy, about learning to see the other, through dialogue, not as a threat, but as someone who, like us, has desires and aspirations similar to ours, no matter how different we appear to be”, said António Ferreira, during the awards ceremony. The Tangier Film Festival took place from the 1st to the 4th of October. “The Memory of the Smell of Things” opens in Portuguese cinemas on November 6th. The film had already won, in June, the best actor award at the Shanghai International Film Festival, in eastern China, for José Martins. In the end, José Martins plays “a forced colonial war veteran to enter a nursing home, where he faces the ghosts of his past and forms an unexpected bond with his black caregiver,” according to the synopsis. The film, a Portugal-Brazil co-production, presents itself as “a poetic and intimate portrait of an elderly person in an institution, exploring the fragility of the human condition, the inevitability of death and the search for redemption”, works on “pressing issues in society, such as population aging and structural racism.”

item.title: Opera | “Carmen”, by Bizet, presented today at CCM
item.description: The Macau International Music Festival (FIMM) begins today with a show that has long been part of the international scene: the opera “Carmen”, which is presented in “Carmen – Opera in Four Acts by Georges Bizet”. The stage is the large auditorium of the Macau Cultural Center (CCM), with the show scheduled to start at 7:30 pm. The production is carried out by the Opéra Comique and the Zurich Opera, directed by Andreas Homoki. This show takes place in partnership with the Macau Orchestra, and the collaborations of the Choir of the National Symphony Orchestra of China and the Macau Youth Choir. “Let us immerse ourselves in a world of burning passion.” This is the challenge left in the official program of the show, marked by a “dramatic involvement and unforgettable music”. On the CCM stage is “an inventive production”, with “pulsating arias and inspired by Spanish musical exoticism and timeless themes”. With this adaptation of the “Bizet masterpiece”, “Carmen” remains “today as powerful and relevant as when it was created”. "Led to the stage by the award-winning Andreas Homoki, the production transports the plot to an austere and meta-theatrical setting. A replica of the Opéra Comique stage becomes the backdrop for a journey through time, in which each act suggests a different era: from Belle Époque Paris to the Second World War and, finally, to the present", describes the program. “Carmen” thus captures “like never before the raw and dramatic emotion of the classic, reinterpreting themes that touch on destiny and humanity from a subtle and at the same time bold perspective”. According to the program, this show can be enjoyed by “music lovers or novice spectators”, as “this production engages and challenges us, remaining with us long after the show ends”. We are thus faced with “an extraordinary demonstration of music, tragedy and seduction”.

item.title: Real Estate | Market to grow in September
item.description: The beginning of September shows a recovery market compared to last year's number of transactions. However, the largest purchase and housing sales also results from prices to be lower now In the first half of September, the real estate market registered an annual increase of 22 percent purchases and sales of home and apartments, with 127 transactions made. The figures were released by the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF). At the beginning of the month last, 127 transactions were recorded, when at the beginning of September last year 104 purchases and housing sales were accounted for. The market was more active on the Macau Peninsula with 102 transactions, 48 ​​more than last year, which represented a growth of 88.8 percent. However, at the beginning of September 2024 the number of transactions on the Peninsula did not exceed 54, a historically low value for this market. In relation to transactions in the first half of September this year, 21 purchases and sales of housing were presented in Taipa, four more than last year (17), a change of 23.5 percent. In Coloane, four transactions were recorded, a reduction of 87.9 percent. However, the transaction of 33 homes in Coloane also constituted an unusually high number for that area of ​​the territory. In terms of prices, there was an annual reduction in the amount from 90,543 patacas per square meter to 78,418 patacas, a decrease of 13.4 percent. Prices were affected by the devaluation in Coloane. A year ago, properties were traded for an average of 124,162 patacas per square meter. However, more recently the average square meter value has not gone beyond 75,292, a reduction of 16.8 percent. In Macau, the price increased to 74,698 patacas per square meter, 6.4 percent compared to the previous value of 70,216 patacas. In Taipa, the appreciation was 30.3 percent to 92,638 patacas, compared to 71,129 patacas per square meter. Stable market When the comparison is made in monthly terms, the numbers show a more stable market, with slight variations in terms of transactions and the price per square meter. Compared to the beginning of August (118 transactions), September saw nine more home purchases and 127 sales, an increase of 7.6 percent. In August, Macau had been the most active market with 96 transactions (102 in September), 19 in Taipa (21 in September) and three in Coloane (four in September). In terms of prices, September had a slight 572 patacas reduction per square meter, as the price at the beginning of August had been 78,990 patacas per square meter. In August, the highest prices had been registered in Coloane, with an average of 83,444 patacas per square meter, followed by the Macau Peninsula (82,734 patacas) and mud (62,219 patacas). Housing | Reduced Price Index Between June and August, the global house price index was 192.4, having fallen by 0.8 percent, compared to the previous period from May to July. The numbers were revealed on Friday by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). The price index for constructed housing (206.7) fell by 1.1 percent compared to the previous period, however, the index for housing under construction (233.6) increased by 0.3 percent. Regarding the price index for constructed housing, that of the Macau Peninsula (195.8) and that of Taipa and Coloane (250.1) fell by 1.3 percent and 0.2 percent. In terms of the year of construction of the buildings, the price index for houses built in the category over 20 years old decreased by 1.4 percent compared to the previous period. The price index for housing in the bracket less than or equal to 5 years and the index for the bracket from 6 to 10 years both fell by 1.2 percent, however, the index for the bracket from 11 to 20 years grew by 0.1 percent.

item.title: Tourism | Request buses during typhoon signal 8
item.description: The president of the Macao Leisure Innovation and Tourism Services Association, Paul Wong, considers that buses must be ensured during periods when signal 8 of tufts is lifted. The idea was defended in statements to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, with the associative leader to ask the buses and shuttle buses of the game companies to focus on tourists. According to Paul Wong, Macau is a tourist city, so it is necessary to ensure that visitors have alternatives to taxis when typhoon signal no. The president of the association explained that in order to protect the Macao SAR's tourist image, it is necessary to ensure that tourists are not regularly stranded and that the buses provided operate in safe conditions. Paul Wong also recalled that the Macao Bridge began to allow circulation during signal 8 and asked the possibility of tourists to travel between the borders, the city center zone and the Cotai hotels should be permanent. In addition, the associative leader wants weather information to be announced more in advance so that the sector has enough time to accommodate tourists, and organize shifts for employees, who face travel difficulties.

item.title: JP Morgan | October with the highest revenues in six years
item.description: Although the growth of game revenues in the golden week is below initial expectations, the investment bank believes that the figure of 23 billion patacas will be reached In October, casinos' revenues are expected to reach 23 billion patacas, the highest value since the same month of 2019. Estimates were made by the JP Morgan investment bank, taking into account the revenues of Macao's main industry in the early days of the golden week. According to the JP Morgan report, cited by the GGR Asia portal, the game's gross revenue reached 5.5 billion patacas in the first five days of the month, which represented a daily average of 1.1 billion patacas. “It was the best Golden Week in more than five years”, can be read in the aforementioned report, which was signed by analysts DS Kim, Selina Li and Lindsey Qian. Despite this aspect, analysts recognize that the numbers were a little below initial expectations for this month: “annual growth appears relatively moderate, with an increase of 3 percent compared to last year's (very) high base, remaining a few points below our expectations and market expectations, which pointed to average single-digit growth”, was justified. The growth of revenues below expectations is not viewed as worrying for JP Morgan, because the Golden Week of 2025 has another day of holiday than last year's Golden Week. Therefore, analysts believe that demand will remain strong in the second week of October. Expectations maintained Analysts believe that demand will remain strong in the second week of October, with daily revenues reaching 750 million patacas, an increase of around 15 percent compared to last year. In the second week of October, a 30 percent drop is expected compared to the first week. This reduction is slighter than what happened last year, when the drop in revenue from the first to the second week reached 40 percent. "Our projection for the month remains unchanged for now, with gross game revenues reaching 23 billion patacas, the highest value in six years, growing between 11 percent and 13 percent over the previous year," was indicated. Bank analysts also said they hope that the growth trend will last until next year, with "sustained two -digit growth of gross game revenues up to at least the first trimester of 2026".
